Drupal core - Moderately critical - Cross-site scripting - SA-CORE-2020-007
https://www.drupal.org/sa-core-2020-007
1.17.1 today?
In the meantime, there are a few more announcements: https://www.drupal.org/security
Thanks @Vladimir and @Olaf Grabienski this is being discussed internally, and there will be a PSA soon.

image.png

We don't display messages about security releases as 'errors' too do we? If so, I think that's wrong...

We do, but they don't have the "error message" title. ...given that messages about pending regular updates are warnings, these are one step up. If we were to "downgrade" errors about security updates to warnings, then pending updates should also be downgraded to info.
Ah OK, maybe it's fine then if it's not displayed as an 'Error message'.
If we want to be adhering to "industry standards" then these should be called "danger" instead of "error"

...see https://getbootstrap.com/docs/4.0/components/alerts/ for example

Alerts
Provide contextual feedback messages for typical user actions with the handful of available and flexible alert messages.
I think that we have an issue for it somewhere

...yup, here it is: #3179

[DX] Use proper 'success' message type and deprecate the ambiguous 'status' type. 路 Issue #3179 路 backdrop/backdrop-issues
